main event: Multiple witnesses in Philadelphia reported observing a large unidentified object traveling quickly through the air on the night of August 6, 1947.
interesting points: Witnesses described the object as emitting a bluish-white flame,It left a smoky trail behind it that lasted approximately two seconds,An insurance agent and former B-24 pilot estimated the object's speed to be between 300 to 500 MPH,The object was reported to be large and shaped like a firecracker,The auditory experience described included a slight buzzing sound as it passed.
witness description: Individuals included a retired police officer, an insurance agent (former pilot), and other neighbors who were sitting outside and facing the direction of the observed object.
